text: More outcomes involves competitive and adaptable workforce, increased industry-academia collaboration, and positive contributions to the software industry's growth and development.

title: MODE OF DELIVERY:
text: MODE OF DELIVERY:

title: All the programs involve live,
text: All the programs involve live, instructor-led classes with TA support. KMIT uses an in-house teaching platform Telescope to not just deliver the classes but also to monitor and track attendance, give and evaluate assignments, have Students compile and execute programmes, conduct and evaluate tests and assess student performance.

title: Some of the features of Telesc
text: Some of the features of Telescope are:

title: a customized version of Moodle
text: a customized version of Moodle, an open-source learning management system provided by Google.

title: provides an option of two different modules. After each programming class, students are required to take a quiz which
text: provides an option of two different modules. After each programming class, students are required to take a quiz which is a collection of multiple-choice questions. Once they submit the quiz, they are presented with a form where they have guidelines to write code (program Eg: JAVA, C) pertaining to the class held.

title: usually three programs given to the students as a part of the test. If the student
text: usually three programs given to the students as a part of the test. If the student is a slow learner, he/ she might be able to work on a single program. The fast learners may go to the third program. Google’s platform Moodle by itself doesn’t have the code compilation technique but Telescope has been built to meet training needs and have added code compilation techniques for Javascript, Python, JAVA, C and few other programming languages.

title: CONCLUSION:
text: CONCLUSION:

title: KMIT brings with it a rich experience of designing customized technical trainings with a proven track record of success. The suite of live, instructor-led e-trainings KMIT has developed offer the best of both worlds – digital innovation as well as industry know-how. Furthermore, the training pedagogy places emphasis on experiential learning and
text: KMIT brings with it a rich experience of designing customized technical trainings with a proven track record of success. The suite of live, instructor-led e-trainings KMIT has developed offer the best of both worlds – digital innovation as well as industry know-how. Furthermore, the training pedagogy places emphasis on experiential learning and is the perfect platform for learning new technologies and/or upgrading basic skills.

title: Mudra - Dance Club
text: Mudra - Dance Club

title: In an age where expression
text: In an age where expression is one of the most powerful tools a man can possess, dance has become more than just a form of art or learning a series of steps to music. It is a way of moving that uses the body as an instrument of expression and communication. Through dance, one is educated about teamwork, focus and improvisation. Hence, the initiative of creating the KMIT dance club was taken. We believe in bringing talented students across all years under one roof, on one platform. The name we chose, Mudra, is a prominent part of a dancer’s vocabulary and is one of the most significant features of Indian classical dance.

title: Tessellator
text: Tessellator

title: Tessellator
text: Tessellator is KMIT’s learning management system. It is customized version of Moodle, an open source learning management system provided by Google. We at KMIT have customized it as per our needs and have been using it on multiple networks. It provides an option of 2 different modules. After each programming class, students are required to take a quiz which is a collection of multiple choice questions. Once they submit the quiz, they are presented with a form where they have guidelines to write code( program Eg: JAVA, C) pertaining to the class held. There are usually three programs given to the students as a part of the test. If the student is a slow learner, he/ she might be able to work on a single program. The fast learners may go to the 3rd program. Google’s platform Moodle by itself doesn’t have the code compilation technique but we at KMIT have extended its capabilities to suffice our needs and have added code compilation techniques for JAVA, C and few other programming languages.

title: Learning Management System(LMS
text: Learning Management System(LMS):

title: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya is an Android App built to give parents all the details that they need to about their ward’s progress at KMIT. From Sanjaya App parents can not only check the attendance, time-table, performance, events and results, but also look at the class room. The live-class room feature in Sanjaya App has been a big hit among parents. From Sanjaya one can also check as to how their ward has been rated for discipline. Parents also receive notifications from KMIT, in cases like class cancellations. Parents can also contact KMIT directly using the ‘Contact KMIT’ feature

title: Drona
text: Drona is an Android App that was specifically built for the teaching faculty at KMIT. Not only does the app ease the process of marking attendance, it also allows teachers to add disciplinary points, easily access timetables, receive important notifications, messages with respect to college events and other important news.

title: Netra
text: Netra is an Android App built for KMIT students. From Netra App they have access to all the details that they need to know while they are at KMIT. From Netra App students can not only cross-check the attendance, time-table, performance, events and results, but also access Konversations- Technical and General videos built by KMIT to help students stay updated with the latest in the industry. Students also receive notifications from KMIT, in cases like class cancellations.

title: Interactive classroom teaching
text: Interactive classroom teaching:

title: Interactive classroom teaching at Keshav Memorial Institute of Technology (KMIT)
text: Interactive classroom teaching at Keshav Memorial Institute of Technology (KMIT) is a modern approach aimed at enhancing the learning experience by promoting active participation from students. This method encourages engagement and collaboration, moving away from traditional lecture-based teaching. Here's how interactive classroom teaching might be implemented at KMIT

title: 1. Use of Technology
text: 1. Use of Technology

title: • Smart Classrooms Equipped wi
text: • Smart Classrooms Equipped with projectors, screens, and interactive boards, smart classrooms allow faculty to present dynamic multimedia content like videos, animations, and live coding demonstrations, making learning more engaging.

title: • Learning Management Systems
text: • Learning Management Systems (LMS) KMIT uses platforms like Tesseract, KMIT vista YouTube channel, Tessellator, kmitonline.com, Tantrik, Toofan, Prashnmanch or other LMS tools to share resources, track assignments, and engage students in discussions.

title: 2. Active Learning Methods
text: 2. Active Learning Methods

title: • Case Studies Real-world exam
text: • Case Studies Real-world examples and case studies are often used to relate theoretical knowledge to practical applications, enabling students to understand the relevance of what they are learning

title: • Problem-Based Learning (PBL)
text: • Problem-Based Learning (PBL): Students are presented with a problem and asked to find solutions collaboratively, enhancing their problem-solving and teamwork abilities.

title: 3. Flipped Classroom
text: 3. Flipped Classroom

title: In a flipped classroom, studen
text: In a flipped classroom, students review learning materials (such as lecture videos or readings) outside of class and then engage in hands-on activities, discussions, and projects during class time. This promotes better retention of concepts and encourages peer-to-peer learning.

title: 4. Interactive Assessments and
text: 4. Interactive Assessments and Quizzes

title: Digital tools like Tessellator
text: Digital tools like Tessellator, Telescope, Toofan, Prashnamanch quizzes can be used to conduct interactive quizzes during lessons, helping students to test their understanding in real-time and get instant feedback

title: 5. Industry Collaboration
text: 5. Industry Collaboration

title: KMIT might collaborate with in
text: KMIT might collaborate with industry professionals, offering guest lectures, workshops, or live projects that allow students to interact with experts and gain insights into current industry trends and challenges

title: 6. Hands-on Practice
text: 6. Hands-on Practice

title: Labs and practical sessions ar
text: Labs and practical sessions are emphasized in KMIT’s teaching approach. Students are encouraged to work on real projects, experiments, or simulations, particularly in fields like Computer Science

title: Benefits of Interactive Classr
text: Benefits of Interactive Classroom Teaching at KMIT:

title: • Enhanced Student Engagement:
text: • Enhanced Student Engagement: By actively involving students in the learning process, the classroom becomes a more dynamic and motivating environment

title: • Improved Retention: Interact
text: • Improved Retention: Interactive learning methods have been shown to improve long-term retention and understanding of concepts
